intro: Senecio guerrerensis, commonly known as the Guerrerensis groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing adaptability to arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters. Senecio guerrerensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
